data.scheme_name: Startup India Seed Fund Scheme  - Startups
data.benefits: The scheme provides seed funding of up to Rs. 20 Lakhs as a grant and up to Rs. 50 Lakhs as investment for market entry or scaling.
data.eligibility: A startup, recognized by DPIIT, incorporated not more than 2 years ago at the time of application are eligible for this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Startup should not have received more than Rs 10 lakh from government schemes. 
  2. Startup should have at least 51% Indian promoter shareholding.
data.beneficiaries: A startup, recognized by DPIIT, incorporated not more than 2 years ago at the time of application are eligible for this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Startup should have a scalable, market-fit product/service. 
  2. Startup should use technology to solve the problem. 
  3. Startup should focus on sectors like healthcare, agriculture, etc. 
  4. Startup should not have received more than Rs 10 lakh from government schemes. 
  5. Startup should have at least 51% Indian promoter shareholding.
data.nodal_agency: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)
data.context: This scheme is introduced to provide financial assistance to startups for proof of concept, prototype development, product trials, market entry and commercialization.
data.objective: The main aim is to provide seed funding to startups with an innovative idea to conduct proof of concept trials.
data.description:
1. Grant for Prototype Development / Trials : Up to Rs. 20 Lakhs for validation of Proof of Concept, prototype development, or product trials. 
  2. Investment for Market Entry / Scaling : Up to Rs. 50 Lakhs for market entry, commercialization, or scaling up.
data.how_to_apply: An online call for applications shall be hosted on an ongoing basis on the Startup India portal : https://seedfund.startupindia.gov.in/about
data.funding_facilitator: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade
data.funding_mechanism: The benefits under the Startup India Seed Fund Scheme are released in tranches based on the startup's progress through approved incubators.
data.additional_info: Preference would be given to startups creating innovative solutions in sectors such as social impact, waste management, water management, financial inclusion, education, agriculture, food processing, biotechnology, healthcare, energy, mobility, defence, space, railways, oil and gas, textiles, etc.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Certificate of Incorporation 
2. PAN 
3. Startup Certificate
4. Board Resolution
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: INVEST INDIA
110, Vigyan Bhavan Annexe,
001, Maulana Azad Road, 
New Delhi 110 001
Email: dipp-startups@nic.in
Toll Free Number: 1-800-115-565
data.beneficiary: All Industry  - Partnership, Private Limited company, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP)  - All Locations  - All MSMEs
